wiki.content:
Written by Benny Andersson and Björn Ulvaeus. Lead vocal by Agnetha Fältskog, with Anni-Frid Lyngstad joining in on the chorus. Originally written for a "Mini-musical" ABBA performed at their 1977 live concerts, along with "I Wonder (Departure)", "I'm a Marionette" and "Get on the Carousel." With the exception of the last track, these songs appeared on ABBA's 1977 studio album, "The Album". ABBA also recorded the song in Spanish as ""Gracias por la Música".
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Written by Benny Andersson and Björn Ulvaeus. Lead vocal by Agnetha Fältskog, with Anni-Frid Lyngstad joining in on the chorus. Originally written for a "Mini-musical" ABBA performed at their 1977 live concerts, along with "I Wonder (Departure)", "I'm a Marionette" and "Get on the Carousel." With the exception of the last track, these songs appeared on ABBA's 1977 studio album, "The Album". ABBA also recorded the song in Spanish as ""Gracias por la Música".

track.name: Thank You for the Music
comments: Yes, thank you ABBA! [2]
Yes Thank you ABBA  - love the song ...
Without a song or dance what are we ?. Thank you indeed for the music.
MelodieFM-dein Heimatsender bedankt sich mit Thank you for the music von ABBA für das Jahr 2012 ich hoffe auf ein genauso erfolgreiches Jahr 2013,ich finde das war einer der besten Title von ABBA

YES thank you for the musis we all love it!  Anyone from Manchester send me a message, any area but I  was born and bred in Withington South Manchester now live on the other side in Droylsden, this song always reminds me of  an Aunt who passed away in 1973 aged 49 she was  lovely....

this video is a shit

i want to back the abba version
Agnetha sings Im nothing Special in fact Im a bit of a bore. well I reckon she could entertain me for a while
A timeless classic its always good to  hear it.
One of their best songs ♥
i love this song~Thank You For The Music
Yes, great...thanks Norris
OK, this is cheesy, but I still love it!
I'm over Abba through cheesy over-exposure. Free at last!
No need to hit the love button, as this music is in my veins
Thank you for the music, Abba etc and last f.m.
makes me soooooo happy
You're welcome.
Thanks Ted
Reminds me of  my dear Aunty Marie who died in 1973 aged 49 - God Bless her
